title: Sledding International
name: Sledding International
description:
A Map by Tracy_the_astonishing

Sledding Hills far and wide the world over. If you know of a place to slide, put it on my map!

Don't forget to be careful out there. Sledding can be dangerous.

***

sledding, tobaggoning, sled, tobaggon, hill, mountain, snow, winter, fun, kids, kid-friendly, kid friendly, kidfriendly, family, slide, whoosh, adventure, speed

properties.name: Central park-East Meadow
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing   An intimate meadow with gently rolling hills. Close to Fifth Avenue. it is easily accessible from Central Park perimeter and invites many visitors who can see it from outside of the Park\'s boundaries.

properties.name: Christie Pits Park
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing    There is a designated sledding hill inside the park. 50-100 ft long, 60-degree slope.

properties.name: Clove Lakes Park
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing    Brookside Ave, Staten Island, NY 10310The Urban Park Rangers hold events throughout the year on weekends, including sled races for kids during snowy weekends on the hill along Martlings Avenue.

properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing    Crocheron park, Queens, NYThis is considered one of the prettiest parks in the City.

properties.name: Crotona Park
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing   Crotona Ave, Bronx, NYGreat sledding. Sometimes a designated city sledding area on "sled days."

properties.name: Danehey park
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing   99 sherman street, cambridge, MAGreat sledding here, plus there\'s a playground! This park is wonderful all year \'round. There\'s a little parking, but not much.

properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing

properties.name: Dexter Drumlin
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing   George Hill Road, Lancaster, MAAs the last glacier moved across the New England landscape over 10,000 years ago, it formed many small hills, called drumlins, like Dexter Drumlin. This inverted teaspoon-shaped hill runs parallel to the direction of the flow of glacial ice. Today the Reservation is maintained as a graceful, open meadow. A small tributary of the Nashua River runs along the western side of the hill forming wet meadows in lowland pockets. Grassland birds make use of the drumlin and the adjacent floodplain fields for nesting and raising their young. A narrow mowed footpath traverses the crest of the hill and loops back along the stream to the entrance. Dexter Drumlin offers views of historic Lancaster and its surrounding farmland and is a favorite spot for winter sledding.

properties.name: Duthie Park
properties.description: Posted by Bogchuff AB10 7FF

properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  395 Rich\'s Dugway, Rochester, NY 14625

properties.name: Ewen Park
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing    Johnson Ave, the Bronx, NYConsidered one of the city\'\'s best sledding parks A staircase provides access to the slope, and it’s long and steep enough that a well-balanced rider can pick up serious velocity. The Parks Department put up hay bales at the bottom, but the wise sledder should be ready to bail out before sliding into the street. The atmosphere here may be the best part as sledders are willing to use any imaginable low-friction object to make a sled, and their enthusiasm is palpable.

properties.name: Flushing Meadows
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing   11101 Corona Ave, Queens, NYSledding, zoo, Shea Stadium

properties.name: Forest Park
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing    Park Lane South, Queens, NYThis hill’s velocity, length, bottom run, and fear factor combine for the optimum sledding rush. Located on the golf course, the hill, which, according to the Parks Department, is off-limits and unsafe, draws a crowd of sledders undeterred by icy conditions. Stealthily crafted holes in the protective fence are a yearly tradition.

properties.name: Forest Park
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing    More tame hills, for the little ones and the timid

properties.name: Fort Green Park
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing    Myrtle Ave, Brookly, NYpacks in four excellent slopes. Hardy kids rolled down the dozens of steps leading from the Prison Martyrs Ship monument, snowboarders caught air on a longer DeKalb Avenue facing slope, and a slew of first-timers squealed as they coasted down the gentler hill abutting the tennis courts.

properties.name: Fort Tryon Park
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing    dyckman st, New York, NYYou can have a tame experience for young ones, and daredevils slide the steep-grade curving staircase with whiplash turns.

properties.name: Greenbelt
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing   700 Rockland Avenue, Staten Island, NY 10306By bus from the Staten Island Ferry Terminal: Take the S57 bus to the Brielle and Rockland Avenue stop. Cross the street at the light.

properties.name: Gritty Urban Industrial Sledding Hill
properties.description: Posted by Jason through this parking lot off multnomah st.Lined with wild blackberry bushes, this short and steep slider features an exhilirating view of the freeway and train tracks and ends in a nice mellow runout into a covered parking lot with dumpsters that used to be full of 3 ring binders.

properties.name: Harbour View Golf Course & Recreation Complex
properties.description: Posted by System This 3 par course is located in a recreation center and features lush fairways and undulating, elevated greens. This picturesque course weaves around a lake and provides a delightful day of family fun. The theme of the complex is a coastal village. During the winter months you can enjoy ice skating, tobogganing and cross-country skiing.

properties.name: Hart's Hill
properties.description: Posted by Justjenn25 33953 n fairfield rd round lake il 60073There\'s a big snow hill and then a little snow hill next to it. The big one is really awesome! If you are looking for a little more adventure then you can take a riddown the"off limits" side. Ther\'s a whole bunch of trees and alot more skill is required here.

properties.name: High Park tobogganing hill
properties.description: Posted by Garyjwood  The hill overlooking Grenadier Pond

properties.description: Posted by Mommy247 addressGreat hill, usually ices over a little so it\'s perfect for sleds and toy snowboards. Hill itself isn\'t too high. My 7 year old and 4 year old both enjoy it.

properties.name: Inwood Hill Park
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing    Seaman Ave, New York, NYContains the last natural forest and salt marsh in Manhattan. Native tulip trees, great views

properties.name: Juniper Valley Park
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing    75TH ST, QUEENS, NYSledding hills

properties.name: Kissena Park
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing    The park\'\'s natural lake is hundreds of years old. The word "Kissena" means "it is cold" in the Chippewa language. Sledding on the East side of the lake.

properties.name: Kujira-yama
properties.description: Posted by DurfA small hill in Musashino Park, Koganei, Tokyo, that became a sledding area when it snowed in January 2006.

properties.name: Larz Andersen Park
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  23 Newton Street, Brookline, MAHills are huge and there\'s parking (which is important in Brookline). Smaller hills are available for those who don\'t want the long rides (and long walk back up). My 17 year old son says it\'s particularly great at night. -Julie, Brookline (boston.com)

properties.name: Latourette Golf Course
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing   Some of the best sledding in Staten Island

properties.name: Locust Valley Golf Course

properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing   northampton, MA

properties.name: Lower Highland Park
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing    Baseball fields in the summer, sledding in the winter

properties.name: Mixville Rd Sledding Hill
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  Sled riding hill on the south side of Cheshire, on Mixville Road, you can\'t miss it. The hill starts out at about a 55 degree angle, but after about 30 feet it tapers to a 45. The only obstacles in the way are small children, but they can be avoided. It\'s the best hill around.

properties.name: Monument Hill
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing   Monument Hill is above the Sugar Bowl on 9th St.

properties.name: Monument Mountain High School Sledding
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing   600 Stockbridge Road, Great Barrington, MA 01230

properties.name: Morningside Heights Park
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing    Lots of sledding variety for such a small park. There are five blocks of steep and shallow slopes, but also staircases and ledges. Great park for beginners and experts.

properties.name: Moses Brown Hill
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  250 Lloyd Ave., providence, RILast January, when I went to Moses Brown School with a group of friends for some post-blizzard sledding, I saw a 10-year-old kid go down the gentler of the field\'s two slopes on a plastic sled. Halfway through the run his sled flipped, and his body tumbled end over end until it came to a stop, his legs twisted over his spine. I was pretty sure he was dead until he leapt up, blood dripping from his face, and screamed, "That was awesome!" I\'m with him. Sledding at Moses Brown is sweet. There are two slopes at the Moses Brown field - one has a longer, gentler ride, while the other is a far steeper, death-defying run. It\'s really a matter of personal preference - you get a longer ride on the gentle slope and you can pick up some speed, but the steep hill is really big. Armed with stolen trays and cardboard boxes - the sleds of the amoral and thrifty - we went at first for the steeper hill. Someone had constructed a large ramp of snow near the bottom of the hill so that, with the most exacting precision, you could hit it and go flying to your death. I highly recommend going for the ramp. I never made it onto it, but that was because I lacked the necessary coordination more than anything else. But I don\'t want to undersell the gentler slope; if you\'ve had enough of the terror of flying down the steeper hill and wiping out at the bottom, it can be nice to take a longer ride down the other hill and fly across the frozen field. And after you\'ve had enough, you can grab a Meeting Street cookie and some hot chocolate - corrected with peppermint schnapps - and snuggle by the radiator. If you\'re looking for a nice winter day of sledding in Providence, you can\'t beat Moses Brown. That is, unless you have the balls to sled down College Street from the Van Wickle Gates, through traffic on South Main Street and into the river. That would be awesome. --Ben Leubsdorf

properties.name: Nethermead
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing    Surrounded on all sides by water and hills, you get the impression of being deep in the forest. Some of the oldest trees in the park surround Nethermead.

properties.name: Norfolk Sledding hills
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing   166 East Street Westwood, MA 02090Norfolk Golf Club in Westwood has several good slopes, but it gets very crowded and therefore dangerous. -John, Norwood

properties.name: Northampton Park
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing   304 Salmon Creek Road, sweden NY

properties.name: Norwich Golf Course
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  685 New London Tpke., Norwich, CT

properties.name: Oakley Country Club
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing   410 Belmont Street Watertown, MA 02472 It has a great incline and a good run. I\'ve been going there since I was 5. -Jim, Belmont

properties.name: Owl's Head Park
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing    Fun sledding. Also home of the Millenium Skateboarding Park.

properties.name: Perinton Recreation Center
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  1350 Turk Hill Road, Fairport, NYThere\'s a steep, challenging hill and a gentler slope. Area is also good for x-country ski and snowshoe with open fields and a wooded trail.

properties.name: Pilgrim Hill
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing   This is another popular Central Park sledding hill. It\'s named for the statue of a Pilgrim which stands nearby.

properties.name: Powder Mills Park
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing   154 Park Road, Pittsford, NY 14534

properties.name: Pulaski Memorial State Park

properties.name: Quaker Cemetery
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing   Quaker Cemetery, is an empty stretch of hills. Bounded by Madaket Road on the north, Quaker Lane on the east, and Vestal St. on the south; it is easy to reach, by taking Main st to Caton Circle. At the circle turn left, the cemetery will be on your right. Turn right onto Vestal st. there will be a path to the cemetery. Comments: There are no real hazards, except in the far NW corner, where there are some old stones. Popular with the young crowd

properties.name: Riverside Park
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing    Hippo playground offers very easy sledding for little ones. Not too crowded because everyone is over at Central Park.

properties.name: Riverside Park
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing    Sledding hills are not crowded because of the proximity to Central Park, which draws the crowds. Great views, some obstacle trees.

properties.name: Saint Nicholas Park
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing    landscape architect Samuel Parsons designed this park. He said, "a dominant note must be followed with a harmonious treatment, a high hill made higher, a rugged slope more rugged, a deep valley made deeper..." He must have been thinking of sledders!

properties.name: Shore Road Park
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing    Sledding hills

properties.name: Sledding Hill
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing   There\'s as nice little hill behind the Matignon high school. It leads down onto the back end of the school\'s parking lot. It\'s not a very big hill, but there is one sweet spot where you get a little ramp effect and you can catch some air.

properties.name: Sledding Hill - Fresh Pond
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing   This is pretty nice sledding hill. It is really long in one part, leading out over a flat frozen area. Closer to the parking lot there are some mini-hills for toddlers. It is pretty crowded on a nice day. The main problem is parking. There is a lot, but you can\'t park in it unless you have a valid Cambridge parking permit. Dogs are allowed in the park.

properties.name: Sledding Hill- Mason Drive
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing   This used to be a pretty good sledding hill when I was a kid, but now there\'s a fence blocking access to it and it\'s all overgrown with trees.

properties.name: Sledding at Martha Brown
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  665 Ayrault Road, Fairport, NYHill in front of the school - great place especially for beginners.

properties.name: Snow Hill / Toboggan Run
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31  This city-run park was the best place to sled. The toboggan run was awesome, and the hot chocolate was always good.

properties.name: Sugar House
properties.description: Posted by Generic  Sugar HouseFamily outing

properties.name: Sunset Park
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing    SUNSET PARK. There is a magnificent view of the Manhattan skyline as well as New Jersey and Staten Island.

properties.name: Sutherland High School
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  55 Sutherland Street, Pittsford, NYThere is a hill behind the school for sledding.

properties.name: The Bowl
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing   jamaica plain, MAFor kids with adults, we recommend "The Bowl" next to Jamaica Pond. As the name implies, it is a bowl. You can get enough momentum going down one side of the bowl that you go up the other side and come down again. Because it is a bowl you don\'t need to worry about kids crashing into trees or sliding into the road. So it is pretty safe for young kids.

properties.name: Thompson Elementary School
properties.description: Posted by Matchups 60 N Union St, Arlington, MASlope allows range of hills from 4\' to 15\', ending safely on large open field. Dunkin nearby for bathrooms or hot drinks.

properties.name: Tivolo Park
properties.description: Posted by DaericeLjubljana, SloveniaThis is a popular sledding hill in Ljubljana\'s giant city park, called Tivoli.

properties.name: Van Cortland Park
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing    Good sledding for the little ones.

properties.name: Wickham Park
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  1329 west middle turnpike, manchester, Connnecticut 06040

properties.name: Woodsom Farm
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing   Lions Mouth Road, amesbury, MAWoodsom Farm was purchased by the Town of Amesbury and features a large expanse of wonderful open space. This has become a popular area for sledding in the winter and soccer in the summer. Other fun activities such as kite flying, model rocket launching, astronomical observing often take place here. Large fairs and outdoor events are often held here as well.

properties.name: arnold arboretum
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing    Sledding, beautiful trees

properties.name: garrison hill tower
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing   During The Summer, It\'s A Good Place To Go With Family And Friends To Enjoy The Awesome Views From The Top Of The Tower. The City Bulldozed The ENTIRE Back Of The Hill As To Allow Sledding And Snowboarding During The Winter. Last I Heard, They Were Putting In A Tow Rope Style Lift, But Have Not Been Up There This Year Yet. Parking Is At The Bottom Of The Hill, And The Top If Your Car Can Make It. Very Good Spot If You Want To Go Fast. They\'ve Installed A Bowl And Hay Bales At The Bottom To Slow You Down.

properties.name: silver city
properties.description: Posted by Genericsilver cityThe mountains above Silver City are excellent for sledding if you can make the hike.
